abstracts.cdata!:
The inspection panel has received two
            requests for inspection raising similar issues on
            noncompliance and harm in relation to the Land
            Administration Project for Panama. The first request was
            submitted on February 25, 2009 by representatives of the
            indigenous community of Pueblo Naso, several individual
            members of the community, and representatives of some
            community organizations. The second request was presented to
            the Panel on March 17, 2009, by leaders of the on behalf of
            the communities that live in the so-called annex areas to
            the Comarca Ngobe-Bugle in the Bocas Del Toro province,
            Panama. The panel registered the requests and notified the
            Board of Executive Directors respectively on March 11, 2009
            and March 20, 2009. Management submitted its response to
            both requests on April 20, 2009. In accordance with the
            resolution establishing the inspection panel, the
            panel's eligibility report and recommendation is due on
            May 19, 2009. However, in light of the general elections
            held in Panama on May 3, 2009, and after informing the
            Executive Director representing Panama, the panel is of the
            view that the interests of all parties concerned would be
            better served by postponing the customary eligibility visit
            for a few weeks. In view of the foregoing, the panel
            requests that the deadline for the preparation of its
            eligibility report and recommendation on whether the issues
            raised in the requests warrant an investigation be postponed
            to June 19, 2009. The panel has consulted with management on
            this matter.
